title: Calories in Ground Venison
meta_description: Discover calories in ground venison per 100 g, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown for this lean game meat.
assumptions: Lean ground venison (deer meat), cooked (pan-fried or grilled), no added fat, salt, or seasonings; ~90% lean.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by animal, leanness, cooking method, and added ingredients. Check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cooked ground venison provides ~172 kcal and ~26 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp oil for cooking per 100 g
Mixed with 10% beef fat for burgers

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g ground venison?
faqs.a: About 172 kcal for cooked lean ground venison.

faqs.q: Is ground venison high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, ~26 g protein per 100 g, making it a lean meat option.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in ground venison?
faqs.a: Around 7.1 g total fat per 100 g, mostly unsaturated.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in ground venison?
faqs.a: Yes; grilling or broiling keeps it leaner than frying with added fat.

faqs.q: How does venison compare to ground beef calories?
faqs.a: Ground venison is leanerâ€”172 kcal vs. ~250 kcal for 80% lean beef per 100 g.
